alert.note: Alert for Edwards (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 11:25AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Edwards County through 1230 PM CDT... At 1125 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Roosevelt to 23 miles north of Loma Alta. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line and Us- 277 Near The Sutton-Edwards County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
